hints.content:
To find the amount of soap Henry started with, we subtract the number of $\text{mL}$ Henry added $(\blueD{177} \text { mL})$  from the number of $\text{mL}$ he has now $(\maroonD{266} \text { mL})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 266 milliliters. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total milliliters of soap. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled with a question mark. The longer right part is labeled 177 milliliters. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Soap started. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Soap added. !

hints.content: The soap container had $\greenD{89}\text { mL}$ of soap before Henry added more.

question.content:
Henry's liquid soap container was partially full.  Then he added $177 $ milliliters more soap to the container.  Now, the container has a total of $266$ milliliters of soap.

**How much soap was in the container before Henry added more?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters
